body.label: verso
body.value:
1. Also, there are charged to you copper bars, twenty-five

  2. pounds, twenty-eight pieces in number,

  3. worth eight dinars; a basket of dates,

  4. one hundred and fifteen pounds, worth 2 ¾ dinars;

  5. the cost of an Abyssinian hide, two dinars; the price of ten

  6. Berbera mats, which are in a package

  7. marked in Hebrew and Arabic, one dinar;

  8. a zodiac carpet, worth five dinars, a maqṭaʿ cloth,

  9. and two Manārī kerchiefs {alt. tr.: fūṭas}, worth six dinars—

  10. all this with Abū Ghālib, the ship’s captain.

  11. He also has with him a piece of lead, weighing

  12. two hundred and forty-five pounds, worth

  13. 28 ½ dinars and two qīrāṭs, the price (per bahār) being 35 dinars;

  14. freight charges for the piece of lead, one dinar. Abū

  15. Ghālib, the ship’s captain, has with him also a purse, in which there are 20 Egyptian mithqāls,

  16. worth 47 dinars (Malikī).

  17. That purse contains (also) seven Malikī dinars.

  18. The total sum: 535 ⅓ dinars.

  19. This settles my lord’s account. There also arrived

  20. the ‘eggs,’ which you sent in the ship of

  21. Ibn Abu ʾl-Katāʾib, and this was received by the elders Joseph

  22. and Khalaf, according to the distribution which you indicated

  23. in your letter. The betel nuts, which

  24. you sent to your servant, also arrived, and this is on {alt. tr.: against} the balance of

  25. my account with your excellency {alt. tr.: which you owed me} from last

  26. year. But the betel nuts were extremely mediocre, both the white

  27. and the red ones. There also arrived what you were kind enough (to send), namely four 

  28. locks and two qaṣʿa-bowls. Your servant has sent to you

  29. with Abū Ghālib, the ship’s captain, two large brazilwood boxes with

  30. sugar, and two brazilwood boxes with raisins, and a package with

  31. three dasts of Egyptian Ṭalḥī paper of the best

  32. obtainable quality. Please accept this, my lord,

  33. and may you think well of me! If you have any

  34. need or service (to be done), I would be happy {lit., ‘give me the pleasure’} to take care of them.

  35. May you have abundant well-being! And peace.
